meanings.definition: Microbes: Microscopic organisms, especially bacteria, viruses, and fungi.
meanings.sent1: In the pond water, the microbes were so small that they could only be seen under a microscope.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study microbes to learn more about the tiny living organisms in our environment.
meanings.sent3: The microbes in the soil were having a microscopic dance party.
meanings.sent4: The microbes in the air were like invisible dancers, moving around us all the time.
meanings.sent5: Under the lens, the microbes looked like a bustling city of tiny creatures.

meanings.definition: Microbes: Tiny living things that can only be seen with a microscope.
meanings.sent1: The scientist discovered new microbes in the soil sample she collected.
meanings.sent2: Microbes play a crucial role in breaking down organic matter in nature.
meanings.sent3: The microbes in the petri dish were throwing a microscopic party.
meanings.sent4: In the world of microbes, each tiny organism has its own story to tell.
meanings.sent5: The microscope revealed a hidden world teeming with microbes.
